article.headline: Idaho 84, Elon University 60
article.story: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) -- Tyrone Hayes had 16 points and seven rebounds and Lionel Davis added 13 points and nine boards as Idaho beat Elon 84-60 in the first round of the Guardians Classic on Monday night. The Vandals wore down the Phoenix with a relentless transition game, good shooting and a deep bench in the opener for both teams. Idaho shot 45.2 percent (28-of-62) for the game and outrebounded Elon 47-30. The final score could have been uglier, but the Vandals only made six-of-17 3-pointers. The Vandals move on to play South Carolina in Tuesday night's second-round game, while the Phoenix play Gardner-Webb in the consolation game. Monday night's game was never in doubt as Idaho jumped out to an 8-0 lead in the game's first two minutes, and was up 37-19 with 5:26 left in the first half. The Vandals led by as much as 25 in the second half. The Phoenix also hurt themselves making just 10 of 21 free throws. Idaho shot 22-of-27 from the foul line. The Vandals, who were 13-15 last season and finished in the middle of the pack in the Big West Conference, played all 11 of their players in the first half. Ten of them would score, including nine before the break. Armend Kahrimanovic added 12 points and Anton Lyons had 11 points and seven rebounds for Idaho. Ten of Elon's 11 players scored, led by Matt Nowlin's 13 points. Jackson Atoyebi, who fouled out with 7:38 to go, had 11 points and Chris Chalko added seven rebounds for the Phoenix. Elon coach Ernie Nestor was an assistant for South Carolina last season and worked for Gamecocks coach Dave Odom for the past 11 years.
